speaker: Doctor
text: What specific symptoms are you experiencing with your vision? Are the black spots constant or do they come and go?

speaker: Patient
text: The black spots are constant, and they seem to be affecting my vision quite a bit. It's like there's a shadow in my right eye.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any changes in your overall health, such as weight loss, fever, or night sweats?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't noticed any weight loss, fever, or night sweats recently. My overall health feels stable aside from the vision issues.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any pain in your eye or around it? And have you had any recent eye injuries or infections?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I haven't experienced any pain in my eye or around it. I also haven't had any recent eye injuries or infections that I'm aware of.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent changes in your medication or treatment for your AIDS? And are you currently taking any other medications?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any recent changes in my medication for AIDS. I'm currently taking Efavirenz, Tenofovir, Emtricitabine, Azithromycin, Trimethoprim-sulfamethoxazole, along with some multivitamins and a nutritional supplement.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any headaches or changes in your peripheral vision? Additionally, do you have a history of any eye conditions?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't experienced any headaches, but my peripheral vision seems a bit off. I don't have a history of any eye conditions prior to this.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent eye examinations or tests done? If so, what were the findings?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any recent eye examinations or tests done. This is the first time I'm experiencing these vision issues.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any changes in your color vision or difficulty seeing at night? Additionally, do you have any history of high blood pressure or diabetes?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't noticed any changes in my color vision or difficulty seeing at night. I don't have a history of high blood pressure or diabetes either.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any floaters or flashes of light in your vision? And do you have any history of opportunistic infections related to your AIDS?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't experienced any floaters or flashes of light in my vision. As for opportunistic infections, I was treated for fungal esophagitis six months ago, but nothing else comes to mind.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent laboratory tests done, such as a CD4 count or viral load test? If so, what were the results?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any recent laboratory tests done, so I don't have any results to share. My last tests were a while ago, and I haven't followed up since then.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any changes in your ability to see colors or any distortion in your vision? Additionally, do you have any history of eye trauma or surgeries?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't noticed any changes in my ability to see colors or any distortion in my vision. I also don't have any history of eye trauma or surgeries.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any sudden changes in your vision, such as a rapid decrease in clarity or a curtain-like shadow over your field of vision?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't experienced any sudden changes like a rapid decrease in clarity or a curtain-like shadow. The black spots have been consistent, but nothing sudden or dramatic.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent travel or exposure to individuals with infections? Additionally, do you have any history of eye diseases in your family?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't traveled recently or been exposed to anyone with infections. As for my family, there's no known history of eye diseases.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any changes in your mental status, such as confusion or difficulty concentrating? And do you have any history of substance abuse?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't experienced any changes in my mental status, and I'm able to concentrate just fine. I don't have a history of substance abuse either.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any swelling or redness in your eye or around it? Additionally, do you have any history of hypertension or other chronic illnesses?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't noticed any swelling or redness in my eye or around it. I also don't have a history of hypertension or any other chronic illnesses.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any changes in your vision when looking at bright lights or during specific activities? Additionally, do you have any history of herpes or other viral infections?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't noticed any changes in my vision when looking at bright lights or during specific activities. I don't have a history of herpes or other viral infections either.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent headaches or changes in your mental status? Additionally, do you have any history of cytomegalovirus (CMV) infection?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any recent headaches or changes in my mental status. I don't have a known history of cytomegalovirus infection either.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any changes in your vision when looking at objects up close versus far away? Additionally, do you have any history of retinitis or other eye-related complications due to your AIDS?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't noticed any changes in my vision when looking at objects up close versus far away; it seems consistently affected. I don't have a history of retinitis or any other eye-related complications related to my AIDS.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you ever been diagnosed with any opportunistic infections related to your AIDS, such as Toxoplasmosis or CMV retinitis? Additionally, do you have any history of eye surgeries or treatments?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't been diagnosed with any opportunistic infections like Toxoplasmosis or CMV retinitis. I also don't have any history of eye surgeries or treatments.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any changes in your vision that seem to correlate with your AIDS treatment, such as any new symptoms after starting or changing medications? Additionally, do you have any known allergies to medications?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't noticed any new symptoms that correlate with my AIDS treatment or any changes in medications. As for allergies, I don't have any known allergies to medications.

speaker: Doctor
text: Based on your symptoms and medical history, I suspect you may be experiencing a condition related to your AIDS, such as CMV retinitis, which can cause vision changes and black spots. However, to confirm this, I would like to request a specific test. REQUEST TEST: Ophthalmologic examination for CMV retinitis.

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS
